title: Taliban claims suicide bomb near US embassy despite peace talks
text:
A suicide bomber has blown himself up in the centre of Kabul, Afghan officials said, with the blast rattling windows and doors in an area near embassies and government buildings.

The Taliban, who are in the midst of negotiating a pact with the United States, claimed responsibility.

It was not immediately clear whether there were any casualties in the attack on Thursday, by a checkpoint on a main road near the headquarters of Afghanistan’s Nato force and the US embassy.

“Ambulances and rescue teams are being rushed to the blast site,” the interior ministry spokesman, Nasrat Rahimi, said.

Video footage and photographs posted on social media showed cars and small shops ripped apart and police cordoning off the road.

There has been no let-up in violence in Afghanistan even though Taliban and US officials have been making progress in negotiations aimed at securing a deal on a withdrawal of American troops in exchange for Taliban security guarantees.

On Monday, a Taliban suicide truck bomber attacked a compound used by international organisations in Kabul, killing at least 16 people and wounding more than 100.

The US’s senior negotiator for peace in Afghanistan, Zalmay Khalilzad, said this week that the two sides had drawn up a draft framework agreement under which US troops would leave five military bases in Afghanistan within 135 days of the signing of the pact. There are some 14,000 US troops in Afghanistan, deployed at various bases across the country.

Khalilzad is expected to meet Afghan and Nato officials to explain the draft agreement, which must still be approved by President Donald Trump before it can be signed. Khalilzad, a veteran Afghan–American diplomat, has shared details of the draft with the Afghan president, Ashraf Ghani, and sought his opinion before firming up an agreement that could bring an end to America’s longest military intervention overseas.

However, Ghani’s government is seeking clarifications from the United States on the draft agreement.
description: Bomb attack in centre of Kabul close to Afghan government buildings
